intro: Anil leptocarpa, commonly known as the slender-leaf anil, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and compound leaves. Its fruit is a dry schizocarp, splitting into two one-seeded parts when mature. Anil leptocarpa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
